column4: hi, I'm trying to install 9.04 on a hp laptop and the installer wont run, there is an error: modprobe: FATAL: /lib/modules/kernel-version****/modules.dep doesn't exist
did you try the Alternate version?
it tells me nothing that i don't know...
try the option to scan the CD for defects. That way you might find out if something went wrong while burning your image.
http://www.ubuntu.com/getubuntu/downloadmirrors#bt  <= See how you can download 4 different versions? (32bit desktp/ alternate and AMD64bit Desktop/ Alternae)

though i don't see how the text mode installer would work better ;), i guess its a bug because after searching a bit there are people with the same issue, and they claim their cd's orked on other machines
In that case the "bug" is tied to some aspect of your hardware. It runs (and installs) great on my box
so you say that if it works on your computer and doesn't on someone's else its not a bug?
mind your language please...You can reconfigure X through the menu to redetect your screeen.

i'm trying to but this window is too big for that resolution! this should never happen! never! is this supposed to be user friendly? i ran on more problems than using distributions that require to configure everyting by yourself
Wine is a compatibility layer that tries to it's best, but sometimes you run into some bugs like this one.
*especially* when you use the Beta versions.
but ubuntu should back to the normal resoltuion instead of keepeng me in 640x480 after the reboot even in gdm
true, that seems to be the bug you have encountered. There is also a non-graphical way to configure Xorg which might help you in this case.
Why would you reboot when you can drop to console mode instead?
